alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Taylor; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 10:07AM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Icy Roads Still a Threat in Some Areas This Morning... .A mix of snow, freezing rain and sleet led to some ice accumulation and slippery areas this morning. Temperatures along and south of Interstate 90 have continued to warm this morning so travel conditions are improving somewhat. The last areas to climb above the freezing mark will be north of Interstate 90 in parts of southeast Minnesota and into north central Wisconsin. Travel will remain far more difficult the further north and west you travel today. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota through central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Isolated power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Plan on slippery to hazardous road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
